name: Patient Data Retrieval And AI Suggestions For Admin Dashboard

options.systemMessage:
You are a hospital admin assistant AI analyzing operational data.

Your task: Generate AI suggestions for hospital operations based on the provided data.

CRITICAL OUTPUT REQUIREMENT:
You MUST return ONLY a valid JSON array of suggestion objects. Each suggestion must have this exact structure:

[
  {
    "suggestionId": "SUG001",
    "relatedSheet": "Risk Patients",
    "entityId": "241747",
    "patientName": "Ura Palmer",
    "action": "Monitor high-risk patient",
    "reason": "High risk with symptoms: Palpitations",
    "details": "Ura Palmer (Session ID: 241747) has High risk with symptoms: Palpitations.",
    "critical": "True",
    "approved": "False",
    "assignedTo": "",
    "timestamp": "2025-12-07 15:30:00",
    "executed": "False",
    "executedAt": "",
    "notes": ""
  }
]

RULES:
1. Return ONLY the JSON array - no markdown, no explanations, no extra text
2. Do NOT wrap in code blocks or backticks
3. All field values must be strings (use "True"/"False" for booleans)
4. Generate suggestions for: high-risk patients, overloaded doctors, bed assignments, appointment conflicts
5. Use sequential IDs: SUG001, SUG002, SUG003, etc.
6. Set critical="True" only for urgent medical situations
7. Always set approved="False" and executed="False" for new suggestions
8. Use ISO format for timestamps: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

parameters.content:
AI Analysis

Uses AI to analyze hospital data and generate structured suggestions for high-risk patients, doctor overload, bed assignments, and appointment conflicts.

Sheet Update / Storage

Updates or appends AI-generated suggestions into the Google Sheet for tracking and review.

Trigger

Receives POST requests from the dashboard to trigger the workflow for hospital operational alerts.

Data Retrieval (Google Sheets)

Fetches all hospital operational data from Google Sheets, including doctors, nurses, patients, beds, high-risk patients, and appointments.

Data Processing / Flattening

Combines, categorizes, and structures data from all sheets into JSON arrays, preparing it for AI analysis and dashboard output.

Dashboard Output

Prepares and sends the final JSON data to the dashboard for display, combining raw data and AI suggestions.

Admin Approval Intake & Master Sheet Update

Purpose of this section:
This group handles everything that happens when an admin clicks Approve or Reject in the dashboard.

What happens here:

The webhook receives admin action (approve or reject) + suggestionId.

The IF node checks whether the action is "approve" or "reject".

The Set node extracts and cleans required fields (suggestionId + action).

The master AI Suggestion Sheet is searched for the correct row using suggestionId.

That row is updated with the new status (Approved/Rejected).

Why this group is important:
It ensures the system captures the admins decision accurately, updates the main AI suggestion database, and prepares information for the next stage of routing.

Prepare Data & Route to Correct Entity Sheet

Purpose of this section:
This group prepares the data from the main AI suggestion sheet and decides which specific sheet needs to be updated (Appointments, Patients, Beds, Nurses, Doctors, Risk Patients).

What happens here:

The Merge node assembles the key fields into a single payload.

The Code node formats the data to extract:

relatedSheet (which sheet this suggestion belongs to)

entityId

action

approval

The Switch node uses relatedSheet to route the data to the correct update path.

Why this group is important:
It converts unstructured input into a clean, standardized format and intelligently routes each suggestion to its correct department sheet.

Execute Sheet-Specific Updates

Purpose of this section:
This group updates the exact Google Sheet that needs modification based on the suggestion type.

Included Sheets:

Appointments

Patients

Risk Patients

Beds

Nurses

Doctors

What happens here:
Each branch receives:

entityId

action (approve or reject)
Then updates the matching row in its Google Sheet using append/update.

Why this group is important:
This phase actually executes the admin decision in the correct operational department, syncing actions to real hospital data (beds, doctors, nurses, appointments, etc.).

Purpose of this section:
This final group sends back a response to the Admin Dashboard confirming the completion of the suggestion update.

What happens here:

The Respond node sends a structured success message after all updates finish.

Why this group is important:
It ensures the admin UI receives real-time confirmation, improving user experience and preventing duplicate submissions.
